verses.verse: The word<WH1697> which came to Jeremiah<WH3414> from the LORD<WH3068>, saying<WH559>,
Arise<WH6965>, and go down<WH3381> to the potter's<WH3335> house<WH1004>, and there I will cause thee to hear<WH8085> my words<WH1697>.
Then I went down<WH3381> to the potter's<WH3335> house<WH1004>, and, behold<WH2009>, he wrought<WH6213> a work<WH4399> on the wheels<WH70>.

And the vessel<WH3627> that he made<WH6213> of clay<WH2563> was marred<WH7843> in the hand<WH3027> of the potter<WH3335>: so he made<WH6213> it again<WH7725> another<WH312> vessel<WH3627>, as seemed<WH5869> good<WH3474> to the potter<WH3335> to make<WH6213> it.
Then the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came to me, saying<WH559>,

O house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>, cannot<WH3201> I do<WH6213> with you as this potter<WH3335>? saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>. Behold, as the clay<WH2563> is in the potter's<WH3335> hand<WH3027>, so are ye in mine hand<WH3027>, O house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>.
At what instant<WH7281> I shall speak<WH1696> concerning a nation<WH1471>, and concerning a kingdom<WH4467>, to pluck up<WH5428>, and to pull down<WH5422>, and to destroy<WH6> it;
If that nation<WH1471>, against whom I have pronounced<WH1696>, turn<WH7725> from their evil<WH7451>, I will repent<WH5162> of the evil<WH7451> that I thought<WH2803> to do<WH6213> unto them.
And at what instant<WH7281> I shall speak<WH1696> concerning a nation<WH1471>, and concerning a kingdom<WH4467>, to build<WH1129> and to plant<WH5193> it;
If it do<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in my sight<WH5869>, that it obey<WH8085> not my voice<WH6963>, then I will repent<WH5162> of the good<WH2896>, wherewith I said<WH559> I would benefit<WH3190> them.

¶ Now therefore go to, speak<WH559> to the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063>, and to the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, saying<WH559>, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Behold, I frame<WH3335> evil<WH7451> against you, and devise<WH2803> a device<WH4284> against you: return<WH7725> ye now every one<WH376> from his evil<WH7451> way<WH1870>, and make your ways<WH1870> and your doings<WH4611> good<WH3190>.

And they said<WH559>, There is no hope<WH2976>: but we will walk<WH3212> after<WH310> our own devices<WH4284>, and we will every one<WH376> do<WH6213> the imagination<WH8307> of his evil<WH7451> heart<WH3820>.

Therefore thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Ask<WH7592> ye now among the heathen<WH1471>, who hath heard<WH8085> such things: the virgin<WH1330> of Israel<WH3478> hath done<WH6213> a very<WH3966> horrible thing<WH8186>.

Will a man leave<WH5800> the snow<WH7950> of Lebanon<WH3844> which cometh from the rock<WH6697> of the field<WH7704>? or shall the cold<WH7119> flowing<WH5140> waters<WH4325> that come from another place<WH2114> be forsaken<WH5428>?

Because my people<WH5971> hath forgotten<WH7911> me, they have burned incense<WH6999> to vanity<WH7723>, and they have caused them to stumble<WH3782> in their ways<WH1870> from the ancient<WH5769> paths<WH7635><WH7635>, to walk<WH3212> in paths<WH5410>, in a way<WH1870> not cast up<WH5549>;

To make<WH7760> their land<WH776> desolate<WH8047>, and a perpetual<WH5769> hissing<WH8292><WH8292>; every one that passeth<WH5674> thereby shall be astonished<WH8074>, and wag<WH5110> his head<WH7218>.

I will scatter<WH6327> them as with an east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> before<WH6440> the enemy<WH341>; I will shew<WH7200> them the back<WH6203>, and not the face<WH6440>, in the day<WH3117> of their calamity<WH343>.

¶ Then said<WH559> they, Come<WH3212>, and let us devise<WH2803> devices<WH4284> against Jeremiah<WH3414>; for the law<WH8451> shall not perish<WH6> from the priest<WH3548>, nor counsel<WH6098> from the wise<WH2450>, nor the word<WH1697> from the prophet<WH5030>. Come<WH3212>, and let us smite<WH5221> him with the tongue<WH3956>, and let us not give heed<WH7181> to any of his words<WH1697>.
Give heed<WH7181> to me, O LORD<WH3068>, and hearken<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of them that contend<WH3401> with me.

Shall evil<WH7451> be recompensed<WH7999> for good<WH2896>? for they have digged<WH3738> a pit<WH7745> for my soul<WH5315>. Remember<WH2142> that I stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> thee to speak<WH1696> good<WH2896> for them, and to turn away<WH7725> thy wrath<WH2534> from them.

Therefore deliver up<WH5414> their children<WH1121> to the famine<WH7458>, and pour out<WH5064> their blood by the force<WH3027> of the sword<WH2719>; and let their wives<WH802> be bereaved<WH7909> of their children, and be widows<WH490>; and let their men<WH582> be put<WH2026> to death<WH4194>; let their young men<WH970> be slain<WH5221> by the sword<WH2719> in battle<WH4421>.

Let a cry<WH2201> be heard<WH8085> from their houses<WH1004>, when thou shalt bring<WH935> a troop<WH1416> suddenly<WH6597> upon them: for they have digged<WH3738> a pit<WH7745><WH7882> to take<WH3920> me, and hid<WH2934> snares<WH6341> for my feet<WH7272>.

Yet, LORD<WH3068>, thou knowest<WH3045> all their counsel<WH6098> against me to slay<WH4194> me: forgive<WH3722> not their iniquity<WH5771>, neither blot out<WH4229> their sin<WH2403> from thy sight<WH6440>, but let them be overthrown<WH3782> before<WH6440> thee; deal<WH6213> thus with them in the time<WH6256> of thine anger<WH639>.
